Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the certainty that no one will lose Medicaid benefits under the Senate health care bill.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that no one will lose Medicaid benefits.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that as long as Florida keeps the same amount of funding or gets an increase, no one will lose Medicaid benefits, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations, such as the Senate bill slowing the rate of Medicaid dollars, which could lead to states making tough choices, including cutting enrollment.
